website_summaries.verdict: This compact, affordable alternative to the Arc offers a simple way to give your TV a needed sound boost.
pros: The Beam measures 25.6 inches long, making it a great soundbar for small living spaces
Connects easily to additional Sonos speakers for improved sound
Its five drivers are designed to improve spoken word clarity
cons: Some compatibility issues with certain TV models

website_summaries.verdict: Although some cheaper options sound better, Sonos Beam is a feature-packed, voice-operated sound bar with unmatched flexibility.
pros: The Sonos Beam is the least-expensive sound bar available with a choice of two voice assistants, Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant
Its expansive sound can fill a small room
HDMI connectivity includes the ability to power up and control TV input switching via voice command
Apple AirPlay 2 support should please iPhone users
cons: The lack of a subwoofer means the Beam lacks deep bass compared to sub-equipped competitors, even some that cost less
You lose connectivity options on TVs that lack ARC
You can't switch between Google and Alexa on the fly and there's some lag with Google Assistant voice commands

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy the beam
customer_reviews.text: This is the most frustrating piece of crap I’ve ever owned. The Sonos beam. Two techs and myself spent two hours including 3 calls to customer support. Finally sound thru the speakers. Connections were good..HDMI arc. Turned the TV off and the speakers stopped working. Power was on and everything was connected. Cost $300 for installation and it never worked right. Angry and frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: will not work with LG OLED
customer_reviews.text: I spent an hour with tech support with LG and anothr 1.5 hrs with Sonos tech support before reading a review on Amazon that they do not work together. Do not buy for LG OLED.
customer_reviews.author: McB

customer_reviews.title: Lip Sync Issue on LG OLEDs is Real
customer_reviews.text: The lip sync issue with LG OLEDs is significant and unfixable if you want DD 5.1. I rolled the dice and thought it might be overstated. It isn’t. Don’t buy this soundbar if you have an LG OLED.
customer_reviews.author: jasmwaters

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.  Customer service is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Received a Sonos Beam as a gift. I connected it to my Samsung 55” The Frame TV. Basically, it will not reconnect to my TV after streaming music. To add insult to injury, I have spent over three hourse on hold with Sonos customer service trying to correct the problem. They DO NOT HAVE A SOLUTION. In my opinion they unveiled Beam before it was fully cooked. The they disrespect customers with a 45+ minute hold time to speak to a customer service rep. I will be returning my Beam, and will steer clear of all Sonos products moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Carp

customer_reviews.title: What a frustrating disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the beam, two play:1s, and the subwoofer for my new tv surround sound. The entire system worked for a couple of hours. The next day, the SONOS app said the beam was missing. For the next six days, I’ve been in SONOS support hell (Reset this and send a diagnostic. Try this and send a diagnostic...). What I’ve found is that the beam seems to be incompatible with my TV, my wifi router, the other speakers, or all of the above. Unfortunately, I’m past the Amazon 30 day return window as I purchased this prior to moving into my home, and the move-in date slipped out a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: RVwino

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH ALEXA GROUPS!
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT WORK WITH ALEXA GROUPS! If you plan to add this to your Alexa speakers for a whole house listening experience look elsewhere. It is not supported in Alexa groups. Setup was very difficult. Will only work with the latest version of Android and iOS. Unfortunately this excludes many phones and devices. Sound is clear and fills the room but absolutely zero bass.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: Alexa integration so misleading
customer_reviews.text: Sure so you can use alexa to control playing music on sonos but it is NOT full featured. If you assume you can play music simultaneously through the Sonos Beam and an alexa device - it doesn't work. They are completely different even though Alexa is on both and the beam shows up in the Alexa app. Wish I would have known this before a $400 purchase as I would have just bought a couple more real alexa devices. Very deceptive and this should be much clearer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Can’t disable Alexa. Ruins the experience ALL the time.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time. While the sound is good from the bar, it constantly cuts out because Alexa thinks it hears something. Sometimes it tries calling people. It’s hard to get into a movie when the sounds cuts out and Alexa starts talking. There is no way to disable it.
customer_reviews.author: EES

customer_reviews.title: A speaker that comes with a lot of headaches
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get the Beam for my new TV. Unfortunately, I should have done more homework on it. It doesn't work well with my Samsung TV and sounds like a common stereo speaker. And if I change my wi fi settings, it's a big production to disconnect my speaker and take it over to my ethernet cable to reset the internet setting of the beam. This happens if I change my password. This is not a speaker you can simply plug in and it works. Takes some tinkering and I still can't get it to sound great (which I read is a problem some others have). I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Sonos quality is well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love the new Sonos beam. Set up in minutes. Connects easily with Alexa. It is in a medium sized room and provides plenty of sound. We do plan on adding the sub as that is the only area it seems lacking. Overall very happy with the product. If you experience any lag between sound and video you do need to make sure the sound is set to "dolby digital" on your TV, it does seem to be an issue when using an apple 4k tv.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Wish they spent more effort on sound, rather than gimmicks
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this is supposed to be a fairly quality sound bar. If you are looking for lots of show-and-tell gimmicks to impress your friends, then this might just be the ticket. BUT, if you are looking for high quality sound, look elsewhere. It does have descent bass, but the overall sound is mediocre at best. The sound field is very narrow. And, who needs Alexa in a sound bar, for heavens sake! A big disappointment compared to my Zvox that finally died.
customer_reviews.author: WestcliffeCO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bedroom
customer_reviews.text: This model is perfect for the bedroom and mounts to a vesa mount setup very easily with the Sonos Wall mount bracket and Mount-It universal soundbar kit. Mounting and setup from start to finish took 25 minutes. The HDMI ARC connectivity just works.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Horribly unreliable; old wireless technology
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good - when it works. But this sound bar almost never works. Even though it’s hard wired to my TV. There’s a long lag on TV audio. Sonos support can’t seem to figure out why. Airplay or direct music play via the Sonos app rarely works, both for streaming music or music from my own library. Sometimes music plays for a few seconds then drops out. More frequently, it says it’s playing and no music comes out. These speakers are based on outdated wireless technology. Go elsewhere. Horrendous value. Poor reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin, Simon, Fyodor

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, great sound, but it should ignore itself when it says Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: I really like my beam! I paired it with the subwoofer and the sound is really good! It understands Alexa commands as well. It does not come with a remote. It works with your tv remote. It also connects to the TVs hdmi return so make sure your tv has one. Set up is a breeze! Aesthetically, it’s a beautiful looking product! The one complaint I have is that when a TV show/movie says a word that sounds like Alexa, the Beam’s sound softens, thinking someone said “Alexa”. It should know better, knowing that it should ignore itself when it says Alexa. Overall, I’m very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR : this bar depends on Sonos services to be online, which ties you up to something you don't have leverage over. I brought this expensive bar for three main reasons: - audio quality for movies -> The audio quality is great !!! - listening to Amazon Music - > problems with the connection between Sonos and Music, took me 3 days to fix it. - Alexa -> stopped working when Sonos tried to enable Google Assistant ... still broken. I'm paying for Amazon Prime so I use Amazon services and everything works fine. I just wanted speakers with Alexa. I never wanted to be depending on Sonos' servers to listen to Amazon's Music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH OTHER ALEXA DEVICES
customer_reviews.text: First off - it's a great speaker for a small apartment. If you don't have a gigantic space, this is the perfect soundbar. Alexa is great, but you can't combine this with any echo devices in other rooms. So if you want to put all your devices in one group to play together throughout your home - you can't! I got this as a present, so I can't return it, but if I had bought it this would be a dealbreaker. Get your act together Sonos + Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: bugly91

customer_reviews.title: Very Buggy Software/Apps - Another Sonos Product Not Ready For Primetime
customer_reviews.text: Was really looking forward to getting the new Beam. Have many other Sonos products, and the ARC connection looked promising. But like almost all Sonos products these days, nothing worked as advertised. The ARC connection doesn't work properly with my Samsung TV, and I couldn't pair the subwoofer and surrounds. If Sonos can't make a soundbar that works seamlessly with Samsung, then Sonos should just get out of the business. Yet another Sonos product not ready for primetime. Really, really wish I had never started with Sonos. Big investment that is very, very disappointing. Why aren't class action lawyers doing something about this?
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: Utterly horrible experience!
customer_reviews.text: First, I have to say that when this thing worked, the sound was great. No complaint there at all. My great dissatisfaction with this and all Sonos product is in actually getting them set up and working with Alexa. OMG! I’ve had this thing for two months and I’ve literally been in a constant dialog with Sonos, both online and via phone to get these speakers set up. Alexa will simply not work with this thing and nobody at Sonos could make it happen. Unbelievably disappointing experience with my first and last exposure to a Sonos product. This thing is going back tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: RPHNOCK

customer_reviews.title: No use of in-built Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I think the sonos beam does decent work compared to other sound bar in the market, the night sound off feature is the best in this. The sonos beam definitely needs a sub for good experience especially when you stream from other devices like PC, mobile and tab. The ports in the back are okay, good they provide the optical to HDMI adapter to reduce the dependency of external adapters. Bluetooth is not available, which is a big flaw in streaming other channels. Connect external bluetooth receivers to get this feature. Overall satisfied with the sonos beam.
customer_reviews.author: nandhu

customer_reviews.title: Sonos doesn't help when faulty
customer_reviews.text: I got my Beam and set it up... Within a few days, it would not automatically connect to the TV when I turned it on, I needed to go into the App and manually select "TV". Very annoying... I contacted Sonos support and went back and forth for 10 days with many different support reps often asking me to the same thing I was asked to do before with no success. They didn't help at all, so I returned it. For a premium product, the beam/sonos was a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: James Costantini

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for this price point
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a little more involved than I imagined. I was not able to complete the installation without hooking up the speaker to my router (temporarily), in order for it to register my wi-fi settings. Other than that, it went very seamlessly. The sound is good (much better than my Samsung TV speakers alone). If you are looking for a more robust sound, I'd definitely invest in the sub and maybe some additional speakers. It's just fine for my needs, as my living room is small. I like the compact size of the speaker. And the design is modern and fits well with my decor.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle V

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is all around the best speaker
customer_reviews.text: I own several Sonos products and like the other ones that I have owned over the years, this speaker does not disappoint! Super easy to set up, offers great sound quality and works with Airplay which is nice. I was worried that the room I was putting the Sonos Beam in was too big for this soundbar since this speaker looked somewhat small in photos online, but it delivers quick a punch! I have this Beam and a Sonos Sub in what I would consider a medium sized room, but have no issues hearing it well across the room (or even in the kitchen which connects to it). Overall, another winner in my opinion from Sonos!
customer_reviews.author: tigerfan87

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it, but had to return it....
customer_reviews.text: Restrictive inputs, incomplete pcm format supports, meant it just would not work for my application. Sound was good as far as sound bar goes, loved ability to pair with my other sono's for TV watching. However, the restriction to hdmi/arc or optical killed usefulness for me. My TV is non-arc, and gaming console wouldn't passthru to optical in a compatible format with the Beam. If they'd just stuck a set of RCA or mini-plug inputs on the thing I would have happily kept it, and bought 2 more for other TVs in the house. But having only HDMI/ARC as the only input? I'm not about to replace all my TVs just to use Beam...
customer_reviews.author: Graysand

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sound...Integrates seamlessly with your TV and whole house audio
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting mediocre sound given it's size and price point but the Beam has a full rich sound that punches way above it's weight even without a subwoofer. What is amazing is how seamlessly it operates and fits in...as long as you have ARC on your TV it will always output sound from your TV and when you want to play music from your computer, phone or voice command it switches over. It's always just another sonos in your house you can output music, radio, podcasts to. Compared to the LG soundbar it replaced with it's finicky bluetooth connection and endless fiddling to make it work for TV and then switch over for audio it's a dream come true.
customer_reviews.author: P. Oh

customer_reviews.title: Great Soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Initially would not power up going through UPS circuit. Plugged it directly into outlet and then it powered up. Fairly simple set up using Sonos2 app. If you have an existing Sonos1 app like I do for S1 (older) speakers, the easiest way to set it up is to FIRST unplug your S1 speakers, then download and start the S2 app. I used a separate email and set up a second Sonos account. Just unplug all your S1 speakers from power, download the S2 app and set up your new S2 device. Then power your S1s back up. Much easier than deleting your S1s from your account (as the Sonos website instructs you to do).
customer_reviews.author: Gaspasser

customer_reviews.title: Just got it - and we're happy! An unexpected benefit....
customer_reviews.text: So we just got it. The setup process on the Sonos side was easy, since we already had Sonos speakers. On the TV side, our Sony TV had an ARC port, but the instructions from Sonos didn't mention going in and finding all the settings dealing with surround sound and the ARC port. Fortunately a quick Google search pointed in the right direction. The sound difference was significant. More importantly, we are at an age where our hearing isn't quite as acute, and the first observation was how much easier it is to hear and distinguish what people are saying, with the sound coming through the Beam speaker, an unexpected benefit.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about all the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Sonos Beam and it is no way near as good as the playbar I have. Yes, it is $300 less but the reviews claimed that it was almost as good as the playbar. NOPE. I had to add a sub to compensate for missing bass I could have had with the playbar I have in another room. Pretty disappointed with this and the fact that there are issues with lip sync when connected to HDMI port on LG TVs. The playbar connected via optical port and did not have nearly as many issues with lip sync though i do notice some minor delay.(yes I am aware the sync issues can be tuned somewhat)
customer_reviews.author: Gritz

customer_reviews.title: By far the best sound around that I've tested and heard, but compatibility issue with Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: You won't be disappointed, but it does have a Blue Tooth compatibility issue with Samsung Smart TV's, which required me to buy a separate HDMI cable, so I could unplug this thing, when using headphones are ear buds. It isn't made to turn off .... but the slight hassle was well worth the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Excallibro

customer_reviews.title: Needs HDMI ARC, nothing mentioned about this
customer_reviews.text: Lacking details that are necessary for purchase. I have two perfectly good TVs but they are too old to have the ARC or adapter option so this is useless for me. Now to find that out you must open the entire box which makes returning difficult. Also this does not pair with EVERY Sonos speaker. Gen1 Play5s are not compatible, another important piece of information to know when purchasing. Very disappointed in Sonos and surprised with Amazon's commitment to customer satisfaction that these two pieces of information were not displayed.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hough

customer_reviews.title: Firmware needs a lot more work.
customer_reviews.text: The product is solid! The firmware needs more details plus a less clunky interface would nice to see but, nobody from company reads these reviews, I am wasting your time just saying what everyone else is saying.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects from TV randomly - Look Elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Sonos Beam connected to newer Samsung TV through them the ARC HDMI as specified in setup. Worked great for a week and now it randomly disconnects from the tv. If I unplug the beam power and then plug it back in it seems to reset and work again. Forums show this is a common problem. Pretty expensive to have connectivity issues. I definitely wouldn’t buy this if you are considering it.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Do not Buy !!!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable, was working fine with my Samsung t.v through the HDMI arc then suddenly stopped working. Thought it might be the cable since it had been connected for months now, so I tried a new cable, still no help. The beam still works with my music but not my Samsung T.V. $ 400 down the drain !!! I had to read other reviews to find out that I am not the only one .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a sound bar that you just connect to the TV and done!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a sound bar that would be a plug and play. I bought it for the living room TV. PROs - Looks great (white) and the sound is good for its size. Easy (ish) to set up. See cons. CONS - Expensive for a sound bar that needs a sub (sold separately for $699) to sound best. You HAVE to download SONOS app and create an account to use the app and configure the sound bar, otherwise it won't work. You HAVE to have it connected to the internet (wired or wi-fi) in order for it to work.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Quality equipment that dropped right into my environment.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound bar and integration into my existing theater setup was superbly easy. Compared to the internal speakers in my 2018 TCL P617 the sonos bar is light years better. Integration with the rest of my sonos speaskers was seamless and when all three are synced the music experience is really good in my house. Interesting side note is you can group other speakers with your sound bar and pipe the TV audio wherever you have a sonos speaker. I’ve found this to be very useful for football as I’m working around the house. While the price be a bit much, you are getting a quality piece of equipment that will serve you for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Kern

customer_reviews.title: Most Regrettable
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work as described. There was no built in Alexa, you have to use your mobile device or IPad to operate in. The technician that I purchased through Amazon did not have a clue how to use product. I did not get my refund as expected back to my credit card, Amazon took the liberty to place my $430 refund on a Amazon gift card without my consent. The company did not choose to correct their error ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Passmore Martinez

customer_reviews.title: The “LAG” is real. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I’m actually very impressed with the sound quality of this beam. Granted I won this beam in a contest at my work so I can’t complain a ton... however if I did spend $400 on this product I’d be quite upset. Please understand this beam DOES NOT work properly with Dolby Digital. The “lag” you see in the other non 5 star reviews is very real and beyond frustrating. Makes me wanna get rid of the beam completely. Everything we watch uses DD so everything we watch the sound doesn’t match the picture. My best advice is do not spend your money on this product until they bring out a newer and more up to date with modern technology version.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Clear Audio
customer_reviews.text: Sonos Beam is a very nice soundbar to supplement my 4K TV inbuilt speakers. Extremely clear quality of sound. Tested with content on Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime and Disney Plus. Disney Plus volume output is so low that I have to set Beam Volume to 70%. Most annoying feature - At times Beam doesn't automatically pair with TV. Whenever this happens I have to Open Sonos App on my mobile and manually Pair. Other than this I love this Sound Bar and inline with my future plans of adding wireless Sub and Bass
customer_reviews.author: Radha Madhav

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic surround sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Polk Command Bar (b/c its sound frequently cuts out) to a Sonos Beam w/ 2 Original Play:1 wireless speakers. Sonos Beam's speech, special effects, crowd noise, etc. is far deeper and richer than the Polk (but also $300 more expensive too). The Sonos setup via iPhone was a little clumsy, but once everything's configured it's really easy to use -- although, a lot of the really important TV sound controls are buried beneath several menu screens -- do a Google search for "Sonos tips and tricks" to learn all of the cool stuff this soundbar can do. Great soundbar overall.
customer_reviews.author: David Kozlowski

customer_reviews.title: can't get it to work
customer_reviews.text: It's not working for me on an Android phone. Hours spent waiting for email reply - it wouldn't accept the Gmail reply from my Android phone. Then it wants me to push a button hidden in the back of the unit and and then it can't sign in to my wifi with the router 5 feet away. Extremely frustrating, it may be going back.
customer_reviews.author: History Buff

customer_reviews.title: No Google cast support
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed after setting up my Sonos Beam only to find out that the advertised "Google Assistant" support doesn't include casting support. Took quite a bit of digging to even discover that fact, and it greatly diminishes the ability to use the speaker in a Google home setup (no speaker groups, no default speakers, etc). If I knew this before buying the speaker, I would have found an alternative. Now I can only hope that Sonos decides to follow through on their (currently misleading) advertised support, and advise others not to make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: Demosthenes

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - poor support
customer_reviews.text: Voice quality much improved tv listening. Disappointing support. Asked direct questions, but support would not give direct answers, instead listed guides and customer forums. Guide required account to get app. Did this but then downloaded BEAM control app would not recognize my password. Did reset to clear this up. Later found my remote would not control sound. Discovered Beam disconnect with modem. Reconnect with modem and now OK. Wasted lots of time when direct answer to problems would save a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Rudolph

customer_reviews.title: For the price no better experience out there
customer_reviews.text: This was my first sonos purchase after watching numerous reviews online . It certainly exceeded expectations in terms of sound quality . For a speaker that size the sound experience is very immersive . High and Low notes are very clear . The bass is good for the size and price however it does need a boost ..... so now I’m contemplating the sonos woofer as well but the 700$ sticker price is holding me back. Unfortunately Alexa doesn’t work where I am in Singapore but that’s not their fault . Setup was rather simple. Well done SONOS team
customer_reviews.author: avinash shantaram

customer_reviews.title: Great Sonos Addition
customer_reviews.text: Needed sound bar for my 70" Flat Screen and wasn't interested in too much bass. This product is great! Really like the voice enhance feature and it blends nicely with my other Sonos Speakers (1 and 3) when I play music. Only complaint - it doesn't work with older versions of Apple TV. I think the HDMI ARC is confused when it senses an Apple TV plugged in. Tech support was great determining that was the issue but....WHY!? Seems like Sonos would be "good" enough to fix it but oh well. My new TV is Smart and I moved the Apple TV to a non-smart unit. Highly recommend - especially if you are already a Sonos user for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Good looks but lacking useful Google integration
customer_reviews.text: The white color looks great and blends nicely with our white mantle. The sound is good (not great) and I'm not an audiophile so I'm not super picky about sound. I simply like high quality products and this is just ok. I don't have or plan on buying more sonos products for the simple fact that their Google assistant integration is pretty awful. It can't respond to simple commands that I use with all my other assistant devices. The biggest killer is that it can't be added to google speaker groups. My old Sony 5.1 has a chromecast audio connected and does this flawlessly for a fraction of the price and it's 10 years old.
customer_reviews.author: awperk

customer_reviews.title: Bad lip sync issues
customer_reviews.text: I found out Sonos has a pretty wide spread lip sync problem with certain TV’s. With my Vizio TV there is a constant lag in the sound that cannot be fixed. You can add more sound lag but not less and the sound is always out of sync. I contacted Sonos customer support but had to end up returning the Beam.
customer_reviews.author: Matzky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome minimalist soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to the Beam from an older Yamaha soundbar. It’s quite the upgrade! I own a few play:ones and I knew the top notch audio quality I would be getting with Sonos. Music sounds amazing on this thing, and I love the integration with other Sonos stuff. I just got in installed, but watched some action-type scenes from Netflix, and the sound quality was awesome. The simulated surround sound is great. I haven’t and most likely won’t even activate Alexa functionality, because I don’t care to. I bought this strictly for the sound quality and sonos ecosystem.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy for multi-room with alexa
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised to be integrated with my echo. If it doesn’t have multi room playability it should be more clear
customer_reviews.author: Swilson98

customer_reviews.title: Sounds fantastic with LG C8 55” OLED
customer_reviews.text: Got the 5.1 package with Beam, Sub, and two Sonos one rears. Sounds fantastic with LG C8 55”, no lag with dialogue and works great with Alexa and music streaming.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ziegler

customer_reviews.title: The app.... doesn’t work well with other ALEXA speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Does not , with the software work to well with Alexa.. it is quite annoying. I read this in the app reviews after I got the speaker and people where on point. The speaker with my tv and with the Alexa on the speaker is fine. The app.... no good.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Li

customer_reviews.title: Nice...but software buggy...
customer_reviews.text: Another quality product from Sonos, once software updated. It took several hours to get this unit online and operable. Blinking lights, without indications of what that meant, and letting it sit seemed to be the answer. Sonos tech support took over 24 hours to respond to initial requests. We had it online by the time they took the time to respond. It works great now that all the software and firmware updates are on-board with the unit. Prepare your patience and don't expect it to connect instantly.
customer_reviews.author: AGR

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for complex setups
customer_reviews.text: Sonos does not want the Beam to undercut the Playbar. The Beam is very simple, marketed as better than TV speakers. It only supports Dolby Digital. Netflix and others deliver Dolby Digital Plus. The Beam assumes you’re using ARC and your TV will convert from DD+ to DD. Anyway why buy a speaker that is so far behind on Dolby standards? The app is ok but not great. Alexa support is ok but missing useful features. The sound quality is good, but I’m not an audiophile.
customer_reviews.author: Weimarner

customer_reviews.title: Not fully Alexa compatible
customer_reviews.text: One of the main attractions with the Sonos beam is it supposed Amazon Alexa compatibility. The Sonos beam is kind of Alexa enabled. It's not a fully functioning Alexa device. For example if you try to run Alexa routines you set up such as saying Alexa goodnight, Sonos beam can't execute it because it's not enabled for that. This is a constant problem with the Alexa ecosystem, a manufacturer can slap Alexa compatible or Alexa enabled on any product they wish regardless of whether it actually is truly Alexa compatible. As a speaker it works great I like it far better than the Sony I had previously but the disappointing limitations on Alexa really have soured me on it.
customer_reviews.author: Bleeding edge adopter

customer_reviews.title: Two duds and third one was the charm
customer_reviews.text: I originally heard the Beam at Costco and the sound was stunning, so I purchased it online. I had to return 2 Sonos Beams before the third worked as it should have. The first two had issues connecting to my wifi--the first would intermittently connect and the second could not update a mandatory update at setup (which a solution was never found). It was extremely frustrating and I gave it one last shot. The third Beam set up within 2 minutes and has worked perfectly ever since. It seems like Sonos wants every customer to have this seamless experience (that I had the third time), but it is very hit or miss if you're going to get it.
customer_reviews.author: KingV

customer_reviews.title: DIALOGUE DIALOGUE DIALOGUE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT it is quite expensive but well worth it. I’ve struggled with hearing dialogue with in movies and would almost always have to lower the volume once the action scenes starts. Then I would have to increase the volume to hear the characters speak. With these speakers I can physically hear the difference between my tv speakers and the Sonos Beam won’t regret buying this! Would probably even buy the Sonos one to create a surround sound system. Pretty Price though
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Sadsad

customer_reviews.title: Best soundbar on the market
customer_reviews.text: Has Alexa built in. Device is surprisingly small and compact which makes the sound quality and volume incredible. I almost bought other Sonos speakers to supplement this since we have a large living room but this more than fills up the room with great quality sound and looks great as well. Set up was easy and fast and quickly integrated into TV and TV remote. Night mode and voice enhancement features are also great options when watching TV late at night . Very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Bit of a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that this unit is not compatible with 5G wifi and therefore can't connect with the Alexa's I have in the Everywhere group and play music/ect like I intended. For a soundbar this expensive, I would have thought that would be a given. Also the set up was difficult (partly because of the struggle to figure out why it wasn't connecting to wifi) and the app clunky and not very helpful. Overall the sound quality is good... not sure it's good enough to outweigh the frustration level but not bad enough to want to deal with packaging it back up to return. This was my first splurge into the Sonos world and probably my last.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great room filling sound
customer_reviews.text: We got this as part of a set that includes the sub and two PLAY:1 for a surround sound setup of the entertainment room. Great sound from this bar. It performs better than expected. No complaints at all! The application that Sonos uses works perfectly on our phones to manage what the speakers play and when. We have recommended these to friends and family. If you are going wireless, the Sonos beam is worth picking up.
customer_reviews.author: TheArtisticRat

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Sound
customer_reviews.text: We have Sono's throughout our home.. When this came out my husband had to have it in our collection.. Works great and great product you can count on
customer_reviews.author: Bellabailey564

customer_reviews.title: Great soundbar, but you *can’t* use headphones?!?
customer_reviews.text: Sonos has packed great sound into a pretty small package, but there’s a ‘feature’ that you should be aware of. When connected via an HDMI-ARC cable, the Beam constantly signals to the TV that it is the priority sound output. Consequently, if you connect a pair of Bluetooth headphones (for night listening perhaps), after a couple seconds the sound goes back to the Beam. The suggested workaround from Sonos is to physically unplug the Beam any time you want to use headphones... which is meh. There’s a thread on this topic in the Sonos forums ‘Sonos Beam and headphones in TV’ (note: had to drop some product names from description).
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship and customer support
customer_reviews.text: My initial experience was pretty good. However, the HDMI connector inside the Beam developed a failure. I do not know if this is a mechanical failure or poor workmanship, but since the connector was only used during the setup, I suspect it is poor workmanship. Customer support wanted to blame my TV, but I verified that it is OK. I also discovered that I could fiddle with the cable going into the Beam and sometimes can get it to work. Unfortunately the connect re-seat into the broken position. Customer support was worthless. The Beam does not work and Sonos will not stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: New Englander

customer_reviews.title: Seamless Soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with the TV through the HDMI-ARC port. Through this connection you control the soundbar right through the TV remote so it's completely seamless. CON: If your TV is older and has no HDMI-ARC, I could see that being a problem. Sounds great for music and Alexa voice control seems to work even better then with my normal Amazon Alexa. Amazingly pleased. Thanks for being awesome, Sonos. Feel free to send me some free Play:1s or a Sub!
customer_reviews.author: Blackbeard

customer_reviews.title: Lousy sound  and no native surround sound suport
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is very poor - barely better than the SONY OLED TV speakers. No bass at all and muddled midrange. People should know that this soundbar doesn't support standard digital audio formats for theater surround like Dolby Digital, Pro II or DTS. No remote - have to use their app only. It tries to "simulate" multi channels and pretty much fails. I don't know why people would pay $400 for this Swapped it out for the JBL 5.1Bar and what a difference - for about the same money you get real bass, crisp highs and a decent upper midrange
customer_reviews.author: richard k.

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to get set up and does sound better than the TV speakers. But other than that, it is a disappointment. Sound quality for TV is mediocre at best and is just poor for streaming music. This is for a vacation home where we don’t watch much TV so not that big of a deal, but I would have returned if it were for a TV watched frequently. I suppose it would be better if I also purchased the sub and surround speakers but not willing to make the investment to find out. For that type of investment or maybe a little more, I’d buy an low-end component system.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but operationally, it sucks
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that this unit is pretty easy to install and does sound goo, but that is where the honeymoon ends. Updating the unit with new software, playing music from any source from within its app and or adding Alexa is a nightmare. I continually get failures and SONIS’ response is reboot your router and unit. Sorry folks, this is an antiquated response and one that squarely blames the consumer versus the manufacturer. I don’t have this type of problem with any other connected device and with them never have to reboot my router. I would stay away from the product until they get their act together.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L Johnson

customer_reviews.title: More than compcensates for price with ease of setup and QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Sonos products are generally excellent. This speaker sounds excellent and fills up the room much as the 1990s-era Aiwa shelf system it replaced. That is high praise. HDMI ARC works great and I can control the volume with my TV remote. Tuning was easy as with all Sonos speakers and it had an instant effect on quality. It gets loud if you need it to, it looks great, and it can be mounted if your TV is on the wall. What’s not to love? (The price). Even though it’s pricey, Sonos more than compensates with excellent packaging, superior user experience, and wonderful sound.
customer_reviews.author: Yousif A. Hassan

customer_reviews.title: No need for HDMi ARC
customer_reviews.text: if your tv does not support HDMi ARC don't panic. My Sony did not and it work fine. what you will lose a seamless integration with the tv volume. over all the sound is like not other and set up is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Honey Badger

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. I unboxed it, put up the metal shelf, hooked up the HDMI ARC cable and plugged it in. Used the app to step by step configure the Sonos and my TV (43 inch LG I purchased November 2018) and less than ten minutes later I was watching video on the TV and playing out the Sonos. A+ for the experience thus far. It sounds good for a speaker this size. I wonder about the remote speakers and sub now.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: i knew it was easy but......
customer_reviews.text: as a current Sonos customer I knew about the set up process, but installing the beam it was easier than ever. Sound is excellent, even better when you have other sonos speakers to group in and then you have sound throughout the house. We have Gen 1 5 series and it links perfectly. Great sound, dramactically different from basic TV speakers. We are very happy, then throw in the Alexa dynamic and we are truly connnected. Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: chris k

customer_reviews.title: Very upset with SONAS brand
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the beam in 2019 along with a sonas speaker. It was perfect in our new home. The sound is incredible. I used Alexa all the time and was very happy. This year my husband bought Roku, and everything went wrong. WE CAN NO LONGER USE THE BEAM OR SPEAKER BECAUSE YOUR SONOS PRODUCTS ARE NOT COMPATIBLE. I CAN USE THE SPEAKERS TO PLAY MUSIC PERIOD, SO CONSEQUENTLY THE SOUND IN OUR TV WITHOUT SPEAKERS IS HORRIBLE. THE ROOM IS HUGE WITH HIGH CEILINGS. WE ARE NOT RICH. I CANNOT RUSH OUT AND BUY A NEW SPEAKER SYSTEM. I THOUGHT THAT YOU SOLD A QUALITY PRODUCT BUT I GUESS NOT. BUYER BEWARE DO NOT PURCHASE THE SONAS BRAND.
customer_reviews.author: MANDY the dog

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Following one review classifying it as one best buy at that price level, and for dialogue sounds rather than music, I decided to buy it. I just want it to watch TV and to enhance dialogue sound which is really poor on my TV on movies, news, etc. Totally satisfied with it. I don't need surround or a big bass speaker as those are not needed to listen to conversations. Absolutely delighted with it. Strongly recommended. BTW: it also delivers great music sound. I am not a fan of the huge bass sound that youngsters love. Besides, when u live in a condo u must be considerate of others.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Sonos. Have 10 of their speakers
customer_reviews.text: This is the latest addition to my Sonos collection of speakers throughout the house. The beam delivers wonderful sound from my TV and great music in the room. Very easy to setup. I found the optical out worked perfectly. I struggled to get the straight HDMI connection to work on my Samsung. Don’t bother with that. Use their optical out adaptor to the HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Is not an Alexa-enabled device, cannot command wifi light bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the sound quality and setup of the Beam, but I purchased it because of the additional Amazon Alexa features. My Samsung SmartThings Hub recognizes the Beam, but the Beam does not recognize the Hub. To find out that it cannot control my wifi light bulbs is incredibly disappointing. Sonos needs to update their software to correct this ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Expensive trash that sometimes works
customer_reviews.text: Expensive garbage. It works half the time with my Alexa and when I want to watch tv and have the volume go through the beam, I have to open Netflix then go back to TV for it work. I called customer service and this was their official fix for that problem. Sound is good but for the price it’s not worth the awful quality of the mechanics.
customer_reviews.author: PMA

customer_reviews.title: Beam cannot be disconnected once linked to other speakers for surround
customer_reviews.text: We bought Sonos because of claims to listen to speakers individually or grouped in any way we like. Untrue! Once speakers are linked to the Beam, they can only with much difficulty be unlinked. So if you have the beam and speakers in one room primarily for tv surround sound and just speakers in another room, when you’d really like music from just four speakers you cannot do that. The overpowering Beam is always connected. The result is a lopsided sound where one room has too much speaker power and volume. Not at all the flexibility hype we were sold.
customer_reviews.author: SW NY

customer_reviews.title: Not Inexpensive; But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I've had a pair of Play 1's for about a year; and been very happy with the performance. I read about the Beam on numerous sites. As a compact soundbar it's not cheap; but I am positively impressed. Ease of set up; re-programmed my Play 1's to be surrounds seamlessly. Alexa works well as to Alexa commands; however the CEC parameters really limit how much the Beam can do with Alexa commands. So far; it's volume and down; and mute/un-mute. If you want anything else; you're picking up the remote. Great sound stage though!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Levesque

customer_reviews.title: Finally a worthy successor to LMS
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Logitech Media Server for around 10 years with Logitech Squeezebox Booms. I've tried the Bose Soundtouch players and they came up short (no gapless playback, no Apple Music, and not better sounding than the Logitech devices.) The Sonos is finally a worthy successor and can even play music from my existing onsite LMS Library. It sounds good, it connects to everything and has gapless playback. You can also tune the speaker to your room with an ios device and I've found that this improves the sound even more. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Eschete Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up and sounds amazing. Allows my Alexa to turn my older TV on/off by voice (HDMI-ARC) and turns it from a TV watching experience to a theater experience. Customer support was fair at best, and I am having a hard time keeping it paired to my Echo. I cannot make it work as an Echo on it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Drewster

customer_reviews.title: Horrible setup
customer_reviews.text: "You may not have pressed the button on the wrong product, or you may not have pressed any button at all." --Just one example of the absolutely infuriating setup procedure for what is supposed to be a high quality modern work of engineering wonder. Oh, and their website helpfully states that they are receiving a very high volume of tech support requests and their response time is about one week.
customer_reviews.author: M. Policky

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is far superior than my previous sound bar. I didn't get any subs or additional speakers for surround, but it still sounds like surround sound. I wish it had a remote instead of using my phone app, but taking the good with the bad, here. Definitely recommend for sound quality and will be interested to see how long it lasts!
customer_reviews.author: Meg.

customer_reviews.title: Freaking awesome
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother blowing $700 on a subwoofer. This does it all. I did get some Play:1's for surround sound but they probably weren't really neccessary. The bass in this sting is amazing. You do not need a subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: NickHale

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Sonos
customer_reviews.text: We were a Bose family for years, but after a buddy introduced me to Sonos and the ease of the system, we jumped brands. I’m so happy we did. I love Sonos, the quality, the look, and of course the sound. The ease of the system is the icing on the top. We have no expended the system to three other speakers. Sonos isn’t cheap, but they are nice.
customer_reviews.author: Envoy30

customer_reviews.title: Great center channel with impressive bass
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a wireless speaker option for my living room as I didn't want to install my home theater and run wires. I have a Vizio sound bar system in my bedroom and I listened to the Beam and Play at Best Buy. I couldn't personally justify the cost of the Phone compared to the Beam. Now that I have had the Beam at home for a few weeks and added 2 Play 1's, I am happy. I continue to be surprised by the bass that this speaker puts out. I haven't found a need to add a bass yet. Very pleased with the three speaker setup for wireless surround. My only wish would be for battery powered Play 1's.
customer_reviews.author: Amandanyc

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar
customer_reviews.text: The Sonos Beam has been great as a sound bar for our TV. I am really happy I got it. The setup is pretty easy and it works seamlessly with the rest of our Sonos system. Only problem is actually with the TV and not the Beam. Occasionally it will loose the ability to play sound through the HDMI ARC. Only thing to do is unplug the TV and plug it back in. Definitely a TV problem. Otherwise the sounds is great and you can tune it with the Sonos app. I can definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ian MazurskyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good but has issues
customer_reviews.text: Sound is decent. Setup is easy but the main problem I have and others in Sonos chat is that the unit never seems to come on properly. Either it comes on with no sound or will start up with the wrong HDMI and you then have to use the remote to turn off all and reset it. Using Alexa may exasperate the problem as wellI am still not sure if I am going to keep unit because of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Boy

customer_reviews.title: Made voice harder to hear
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar was great for music and OK for movies, but for regular TV I found the voices hard to hear. The automatic balancing function worked well and really did a great job putting the sound where it belonged for movies. Overall, it was a good product. If my aim was better music or movies, this would have been great, but I bought it primarily to make voices easier to hear. The standard TV speakers were better for voices so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cox

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to love this!!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning. It sounded great! WHEN IT WORKED. It cut out alot and then would drop off the grouping. Even when I just tried to watch tv and listen to a movie...mostly nothing. I would spend most time trying to get it to work. I only have 1400 sq ft home...so I know I did not need the boost. wifi router was not that far from it and the Play 1's I have never drop off. Hopefully they will work out the kinks and I will buy a future model. But not this one. Too much effort to get to work for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D

customer_reviews.title: Best add on to TV ever. Can hear all dialogue.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic addition to our TV plus all the Sonos and Alexa capability. NOW we can hear every word when someone speaks. Easy to set up. Used the included optical cable to the TV and told TV settings to use it. Works perfectly. Alexa does everything and the sound is fantastic. Easily added two of the older Sonos 1 speakers in the back of the room and they work flawlessly. Hoping for a subwoofer that is in this price range to add in the future. BEST add on to our TV ever. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Crisp sound with all the smart home features.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is awesome. Got both beams and a pair of ones. Easy set up. Must use their app to set it up. Arc2 works on this and able to command Alexa to turn on tv, change volumes, and with firetv can ask Alexa to search for shows or movies. I don’t have google chrome cast so am unsure if google functions but I know for sure it can run google home too. Paired it with ones to give it surround sound effect for movies. Love how it has airplay2 functions as well and can jam out streaming from my phone or MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Writing the review after about 6 months of use. Not an audiophile but i love and look for great sound. Has delivered beyond my expectations. To bad the sub is way to over priced. Sounds great as is
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Good souundar/Sonos speaker
customer_reviews.text: Great aoundbae for both the TV and whole house audio (automatically switches rob tab when you turn it on, which is great) Have various sonos products and I like them all. They also have terrific tech support who is actually knowledgeable and can fix issues if they ever come up. Sonos as a system is great and hard to beat. I hope they’ll come up with even bigger version that will replace they older larger soundbars. And that they’ll add DTS support (currently missing).
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: Great Sonos speaker.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful in white, high quality. The sound is amazing. I was concerned because my room is much larger than recommended for this Sonos size but the sound rocks. It sounds great playing music and also just for the TV. It has turned our TV experience into an awesome one. We are very happy to have purchased it. The installation was easy. BTW, the bass on this thing is very good. I don't foresee having to ever purchase the Sub for $699 with this Sonos Beam.
customer_reviews.author: C. Subrenat

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Sonos Playbar prior too and I must say for a smaller home or any cord cutters this is the way to go. Sound is second to none. Unlike the Playbar the Beam hooks up through HDMI which for someone using Fire TV is very important because Dolby digital plus does not work through optical (Playbars only option) . Also the Beam comes with Alexa built in , with speaker on off button too, for those who are not into AI.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Solid alternative to Playbar for bedroom TV setup
customer_reviews.text: We have Sonos components throughout our house (best decision ever) and were looking for ways to attach a speaker to our older bedroom TV. Didn't want to pony up $600+ for another Playbar so were happy to learn of the Beam. Long story short, it was easy to set up and sounds great! Minimal footprint in front of the TV on the dresser and looks sleek. Bought a "used like new" via Amazon Warehouse and have zero complaints. Can't recommend Sonos highly enough (just wish they didn't discontinue the Play 3)!
customer_reviews.author: Carly C

customer_reviews.title: Short the stock
customer_reviews.text: My vizio sound bar with sub sounded better and I paid 99 dollars for it at costco. I got my Beam from Amazon and it was a warehouse deal.. since it had been set up once before and was not fun to set up. Calling in for support took so long I had to plug in my phone so the battery wouldn't die.. I want to learn how to short the sonos stock.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and great look
customer_reviews.text: After months of reading and watching review after review on this item I was worried that it wouldn't be loud enough. All the descriptions mention that this is for a small to medium size room.... That is wrooong..... this can be easily used for a large room no need to upgrade to the larger Sonos speaker or have the sub unless I guess you have a million $$$$ home with a million dollar movie room and if you do I advise you to buy speakers that are mounted inside the walls just look better and would blow this sound out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Drre

customer_reviews.title: Great Speaker
customer_reviews.text: I saw this speaker at costco and planned to buy it but it was Black Friday and the costco website couldn't handle the traffic and so their site wasn't working. That being the case I found it here on Amazon for the same price and bought it. It's such a great speaker and works great with our TV. We liked it so much that my wife and I bought two more Sonos speakers that we have place around the house so we can use all three speakers to play music. It's a great sound bar and we're glad we purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gier

customer_reviews.title: Wish we'd bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: We've had a SONOS system for a long time. But we never quite made the jump with a sound bar for the tv. We decided to get this one and I am soooo glad we did. It handles voices/conversations in movies so much better than our previous speaker. I think we may eventually get one for the basement tv as well! It acts as a tv speaker when watching tv but also a regular sonos speaker when the tv is off and we are playing music. The best of both worlds!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great after setup, but Alexa hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: Had to connect via the included optical cable as my tv is old enough to not have HDMI-arc. Sounded horrible until I ran the adjustment routine from my iPhone, then it sounds great - as good as former separate 3.1 high end system. Has reasonable low end fullness and crisp voices (TV) and treble (Amazon Prime music). Alexa worked well in the beginning, but has stopped working and has needed reinstallation. Not as reliable as our Amazon devices. Still happy.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between this and the Sonos Playbar which was much more expensive. I ended up going with the beam and am very pleased. The audio is far superior to the tv speakers i had previously been using and it also works great for music too. For the price I don't think this can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased more sound bars than I care to admit, and this is by far the best. Very clear, crisp sound, and the Alexa (or Google Assistant) functionality works very well. It's also low profile enough that you can put it in front of a tv, and it will not black the screen (I had that problem with my previous Bose soundbar). I would recommend buying the Sonos subwoofer with it. It is expensive, but it makes you feel like you are in a movie theater.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL

product_meta.title: Sonos Beam - Smart TV Sound Bar with Amazon Alexa Built-in - Black
